MathUtil Class

Defined in: js/util/MathUtil.js:18
Module: util
Parent Module: StructureJS

A helper class to do calculations and conversions.

constrain
(
  • num
  • min
  • max
)
Number

Defined in js/util/MathUtil.js:31

Returns a number constrained between min and max.

Parameters:

  • num Number
  • min Number
  • max Number

Returns:

Number:

Example:

 MathUtil.constrain(12, 3, 20);
 // 12

 MathUtil.constrain(22, 3, 20);
 // 20

 MathUtil.constrain(0, 3, 20);
 // 3

degreesToRadians
(
  • degrees
)
Number

Defined in js/util/MathUtil.js:169

Converts degrees to radians.

Parameters:

  • degrees Number

Returns:

Number:

Example:

 MathUtil.degreesToRadians(90);
 // 1.5707963267948966

 MathUtil.degreesToRadians(180);
 // 3.141592653589793

(
  • num
)
Number

Defined in js/util/MathUtil.js:298

Calculate the factorial of the integer.

Parameters:

  • num Number

    The number.

Returns:

Number:

Example:

 MathUtil.factorial(5);
 // 120

 MathUtil.factorial(9);
 // 362880

Boolean:

map
(
  • num
  • min1
  • max1
  • min2
  • max2
)
Number

Defined in js/util/MathUtil.js:121

Re-maps a number from one range to another. The output is the same as inputing the result of rangeToPercent() numbero percentToRange(). Example: num = 10, min1 = 0, max1 = 100, min2 = 0, max2 = 50 // outputs 5

Parameters:

  • num Number
  • min1 Number
  • max1 Number
  • min2 Number
  • max2 Number

Returns:

Number:

Example:

 MathUtil.map(10, 0, 100, 0, 50);
 // 5

percentToRange
(
  • percent
  • min
  • max
)
Number

Defined in js/util/MathUtil.js:105

Returns the number that corresponds to the percentage in a given range. Example: percent = 0.5 range 10 to 20 // outputs 15

Parameters:

  • percent Number
  • min Number
  • max Number

Returns:

Number:

Example:

 MathUtil.percentToRange(0.5, 10, 20);
 // 15

rangeToPercent
(
  • num
  • min
  • max
  • constrainMin
  • constrainMax
)
Number

Defined in js/util/MathUtil.js:79

Returns the percentage of a number in a given range. Example: num = 15 range 10 to 20 // outputs 0.5

Parameters:

  • num Number
  • min Number
  • max Number
  • constrainMin Boolean

    Returns 0 if num < min.

  • constrainMax Boolean

    Returns 1 if num > max.

Returns:

Number:

Example:

 MathUtil.rangeToPercent(15, 10, 20);
 // 0.5

sign
(
  • num
)
Number

Defined in js/util/MathUtil.js:185

Returns 1 if the value is >= 0. Returns -1 if the value is < 0.

Parameters:

  • num Number

Returns:

Number:

Example:

 MathUtil.sign(23);
 // 1

 MathUtil.sign(-23);
 // -1
